page.title: 06CHANCE TO SHARE
page.content: The school is situated in Park Avenue, Sutterton.It is a combination of four village schools which were closed in 1978.(Algarkirk,Fosdyke,Wigtoft and Sutterton).The new school opened on April 10th,1978.The school was originally intended to be a Middle School but Comprehensive education was not implemented and so the school is not large enough,and the top class have a mobile classroom. The school is unique in that it has a chance to share.This means that the community has paid for part of the facilities of the school (they have just built a new lounge and kitchen on the site of the old school kitchen), and they can use the school in and out of school hours.School meals were abolished in Primary Schools on 27/3/81.The Head Teacher,Mr.D.Steel liaises closely with the community.
